Row.Text: Additional Military policy slot. +7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when attacking city-states.

All cities you found or conquer start with a Trading Post. If in [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route range of your [ICON_Capital] Capital, they also start with a road to it. Your [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes earn +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold for passing through Trading Posts in your own cities.
One extra Wildcard policy slot in any government.
Inquisitors can Remove Heresy one extra time. Combat units have a bonus of +4 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength against players following other Religions.
Builds Encampment, Holy Site and Theater Square districts in half the time. Luxury resources in his territory provide an Amenity to 2 extra cities.

Units receive a +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength on their home continent. Automatically receive the final Great Prophet when the next-to-last one is claimed (if you have not earned a Great Prophet already). +1 [ICON_Science] Science for each foreign city following Alessia's Religion.

Receive double [ICON_GreatMusician] Great Musician points. +3 [ICON_Faith] Faith from each [ICON_GreatWork_Relic] Relic, [ICON_GreatWork_Artifact] Artifact, and Sculpture [ICON_GreatWork_Sculpture] Great Work of Art in addition to the usual [ICON_Culture] Culture. +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture and +1 [ICON_Production] Production from Tundra.

Receive double [ICON_GreatMusician] Great Musician points. +3 [ICON_Faith] Faith from each [ICON_GreatWork_Relic] Relic, [ICON_GreatWork_Artifact] Artifact, and Sculpture [ICON_GreatWork_Sculpture] Great Work of Art in addition to the usual [ICON_Culture] Culture. +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture and +1 [ICON_Production] Production from Tundra. Units do not receive damage from Blizzards.

Your [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to other civilizations provide +4 [ICON_Food] Food and +3 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science for Skyrim. Other civilizations' [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to Skyrim provide +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture for them

All found or conquered cities on a continent other than your home continent receive a free melee unit. Land units receive +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength in land tiles adjacent to Coast. Units gain the ability to enter Ocean tiles after researching the Shipbuilding technology. Extra territory upon founding cities.
Units receive a +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength on their home continent. Combat victories provide [ICON_Culture] Culture equal to 50% of the [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength of the defeated unit.
Commercial Hub, Harbor, Campus, Holy Site and Theater receive an additional standard adjacency bonus for being adjacent to another district or being adjacent to the Coast

Land units receive +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength in land tiles adjacent to Coast. May declare war on anyone at war with their allies without warmonger penalties. When at war with a common foe, they and their allies share pillage rewards and share combat experience gains if within 5 tiles.

Rainforest tiles provide +1 adjacency bonus for Campus, Commercial Hub, Holy Site, and Theater Square districts. Marshes also provide a +2 Bonus for each district. Rainforest and Marshes tiles provide +1 [ICON_Housing] Housing for Neighborhoods built adjacent to them.
All units receive +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when attacking wounded units. When they eliminate a unit, they heal up to 50 hit points.
Allows coastal raiding for all naval melee units. Naval units receive +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength in shallow water tiles.

All cities you found or conquer start with a Trading Post. If in [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route range of your [ICON_Capital] Capital, they also start with a road to it. Your [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes earn +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold for passing through Trading Posts in your own cities. Has 1 level of [ICON_VisLimited] Diplomatic Visibility greater than normal with every civilization that she's met. Receives capacity to build an extra Spy with the Castles technology.

Comercial Hub district gains +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold for adjacency to Deserts. Your [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to other civilizations provide +4 [ICON_Gold] Gold for Keirgo. Other civilizations' [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to Keirgo provide +2 [ICON_Food] Food for them and +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold for Keirgo.

Your [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to other civilizations provide +3 [ICON_Culture] Culture and +3 [ICON_Faith] Faith for Eshita. Other civilizations' [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to Eshita provide +2 [ICON_Food] Food for them and +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold for Eshita. Commercial Hub receive an additional standard adjacency bonus for being being adjacent to the Jungles.
Combat victories provide [ICON_Culture] Culture equal to 50% of the [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength of the defeated unit. Desert terrain gives food as Grasslands to other Civilizations.

Combat victories provide [ICON_Culture] Culture equal to 50% of the [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength of the defeated unit. Desert terrain gives food as Grasslands to other Civilizations. Units do not receive damage from Dust Storms.

Units receive a +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength on their home continent. May declare war on anyone at war with their allies without warmonger penalties. When at war with a common foe, they and their allies share pillage rewards and share combat experience gains if within 5 tiles.
Military units receive +1 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength for each different Luxury resource improved in Morrowind lands.

Inquisitors can Remove Heresy one extra time. When you capture a Barbarian Outpost, receive a Tribal Village reward in addition to the usual [ICON_Gold] Gold. Pay half the usual cost to levy city-state units.
One extra Wildcard policy slot in any government.

Combat units have a bonus of +4 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength against players following other Religions. This worship building is enhanced to add 10% to the [ICON_Science] Science, [ICON_Faith] Faith, and [ICON_Culture] Culture output of Vivec cities.

[ICON_TechBoosted] Eurekas provide 60% of technologies instead of 50%. +5 [ICON_Faith] Faith for each civilization (including Morrowind) they have met that has founded a Religion and is not currently at war.

Rainforest and Forest tiles provide +1 adjacency bonus for Campus, Commercial Hub, Holy Site, and Theater Square districts. Rainforest tiles provide +1 [ICON_Housing] Housing for Neighborhoods built adjacent to them.

Receives [ICON_Science] Science or [ICON_Culture] Culture from [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to civilizations that are more advanced than Russia (+1 per 3 technologies or civics ahead). All cities start with an additional City Center building. (Starts with a Monument building in the Ancient era).
Additional Military policy slot. +7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when attacking city-states.
+5% [ICON_Culture] Culture and +4% [ICON_Science] Science per city-state you are the Suzerain of.
+4 Influence points per turn toward earning city-state [ICON_Envoy] Envoys. +4 [ICON_Gold] Gold from each city-state you are Suzerain of.
Additional Military policy slot. +7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when attacking city-states.
Each city can build one more district than usual (exceeding the normal limit based on [ICON_Citizen] Population).

Additional Military policy slot. +7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when attacking city-states. Extra territory upon founding cities. +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith and +1 [ICON_Production] Production from Tundra.

Additional Military policy slot. +7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when attacking city-states. Extra territory upon founding cities. +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith and +1 [ICON_Production] Production from Tundra. Units do not receive damage from Blizzards.

Combat victories provide [ICON_Culture] Culture and [ICON_Gold] Gold equal to 50% of the [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength of the defeated unit. All cities start with an additional City Center building. (Starts with a Monument building in the Ancient era).
One extra Wildcard policy slot in any government.
Combat victories provide [ICON_Culture] Culture equal to 50% of the [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength of the defeated unit. +4 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength against players following other Religions.

All units receive +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when attacking wounded units. When they eliminate a unit, they heal up to 50 hit points. +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith and +1 [ICON_Production] Production from Tundra.

All units receive +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when attacking wounded units. When they eliminate a unit, they heal up to 50 hit points. +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith and +1 [ICON_Production] Production from Tundra. Units do not receive damage from Blizzards. Civilizations that are at war with you receive +100% unit damage from Blizzards in your territory.

All your Routes between your cities give 1 [ICON_Science] Science. +20% [ICON_Production] Production toward Medieval, Renaissance, and Industrial era wonders. When building Ancient and Classical wonders you may spend Builder charges to complete 15% of the original wonder cost.
+6 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength for all Anti-Cavalry units. Additional Military policy slot.
All districts receive an additional standard adjacency bonus for being adjacent to another district.
Industrials Zones gains +1 [ICON_Production] Production and Campus gains +1 [ICON_Science] Science if they are next to a Mountain.
Industrials Zones gains +1 [ICON_Production] Production and Campus gains +1 [ICON_Science] Science if they are next to a Mountain. Units do not receive damage from Blizzards.
Units receive a +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength on their home continent. Your Industrial Zones districts provide +1 [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route capacity each.

All units receive +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when attacking wounded units. When they eliminate a unit, they heal up to 50 hit points. Spend Builder charges to complete 20% of the original district cost.
Additional Military policy slot. +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting on a continent other that your [ICON_Capital] Capital's.

Units receive a +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength on their home continent. The worship building for their Religion is enhanced to add 10% to the [ICON_Science] Science, [ICON_Faith] Faith, and [ICON_Culture] Culture output of Arabian cities.
One extra Wildcard policy slot in any government.

Snow terrain gives food as Grasslands to other Civilizations. Extra territory upon founding cities. +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith and +1 [ICON_Production] Production from Tundra. Builds Encampment districts in half the time.

Snow terrain gives food as Grasslands to other Civilizations. Extra territory upon founding cities. +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith and +1 [ICON_Production] Production from Tundra. Builds Encampment districts in half the time. Units do not receive damage from Blizzards. Civilizations that are at war with you receive +100% unit damage from Blizzards in your territory.

Land units receive +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength in land tiles adjacent to Coast; naval units receive +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength in shallow water tiles. Units gain the ability to enter Ocean tiles after researching the Shipbuilding technology.
Commercial Hub, Harbor, Campus, Holy Site and Theater receive an additional standard adjacency bonus for being being adjacent to the Coast or Jungles.

Land units receive +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength in land tiles adjacent to Coast; naval units receive +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength in shallow water tiles. Units gain the ability to enter Ocean tiles after researching the Shipbuilding technology.
Imperial unique melee unit. +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength if there is at least one Legionnaire adjacent. Can build a Imperial Fort.
Skyrim unique melee unit. +7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength on Tundra Tiles.
Altmer unique melee unit. This unit does not suffer combat penalties when damaged.
Altmer unique ranged unit. This unit heals every turn, even after moving or combat.
Argonian unique melee unit. +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength on Jungles and Marsh Tiles.
Argonian unique anticavalry unit. +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength if there is at least one Shellback adjacent.
Khajit unique melee unit. +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength on the home continent.
Redguard unique melee unit. +7 [ICON_Strength]Combat Strength when attacking, and -7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when defending.
Dark Elf unique melee unit. +7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when defending vs. ranged attacks.
Dark Elf unique ranged unit. +7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength vs. land units.
Bosmer unique ranger unit. Can move through Woods and Rainforest without [ICON_Movement] Movement penalty. +200% flanking bonus.
Bosmer unique melee unit. Can move through Woods and Rainforest without [ICON_Movement] Movement penalty.
Breton unique melee unit. This unit does not suffer combat penalties when damaged.
Breton unique ranged unit. This unit heals every turn, even after moving or combat.
Orc unique melee unit. +7 [ICON_Strength]Combat Strength when attacking, and -7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when defending.
Oblivion unique melee unit. -5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength to adjacent enemy units.
Oblivion unique ranged unit. +7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength vs. units in districts.
Oblivion unique melee unit. Faster than warriors and easier to produce.
Oblivion unique melee unit. +10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength Marsh Tiles.
Ayleid unique melee unit. +7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when defending.
Dwemer unique light cavalry unit. Can move after attacking.
Dwemer unique heavy cavalry unit. Pushes defending enemy units back from their hex in any battle where they score more damage. Defenders that cannot retreat suffer additional damage.
Dwemer unique melee unit. Pushes defending enemy units back from their hex in any battle where they score more damage. Defenders that cannot retreat suffer additional damage.
Taesci unique melee unit. +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting on Hills.
Taesci unique melee unit. This unit heals every turn, even after moving or combat.
Kamal unique melee unit. -5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength to adjacent enemy units.
Pyandonea unique naval melee unit. Cannot be seen unless adjacent to it.
Skyrim unique building. +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith, +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture, +1 Great Prophet Point and +2 Relic Slots.
Khajit unique building. +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold, +1 [ICON_Production] Production, +1 Great Merchant Point.
Hammerfel unique building that replace the Market. +3 [ICON_Gold] Gold, +2 [ICON_Food] Food, +2 Great Merchant Point.
High Rock unique building that replace the Library. +3 [ICON_Science] Science, +2 Great Scientist Point.
Ka Potun unique building that replace the Temple. +4 [ICON_Faith] Faith, +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture, +1 Great Prophet and General Points.
Argonians unique District that replace the Holy Site district. +2 Great Prophet and +2 Great Scientist Points. Double Faith bonus for being adjacent to Forests.

A district unique to the Bosmer that can only be constructed in Rainforest or Woods. Replaces the Neighborhood district but is available earlier. Provides +5 [ICON_Housing] Housing , +2 [ICON_Food] Food, and +4 [ICON_Gold] Gold, regardless of Appeal.

Unlocks the Imperial Legionnaire ability to construct an Imperial Fort, unique to Cyrodilic Empire.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Occupying unit receives +6 [ICON_Strength] Defense Strength, and automatically gains 2 turns of fortification.

Skyrim unique improvement, that can only be build on hills (except desert hills). Needs to be 2 tiles distance from another Word Wall. +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith, +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture. If next to a Holy Site it gains an extra +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith.

Argonian unique improvement, that can only be build glasslands or plains. +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold, +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture. If next to a River it gains an extra +1 [ICON_Science] Science. Cannot be built on Hills.

Morrowind unique improvement. Occupying unit receives +2 [ICON_Strength] Defense Strength, and automatically gains 2 turns of fortification. +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture, +5 [ICON_Food] Food. If next to a Encampent gains a +1 [ICON_Production].
Morrowind unique improvement. +1 [ICON_Production] Production, +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold. If next to a Camp gains a +3 [ICON_Production] and +1 [ICON_Food] Food.

Orsinium unique improvement. Occupying unit receives +4 [ICON_Strength] Defense Strength, and automatically gains 2 turns of fortification. +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold, +1 [ICON_Production] Production. If next to a Encampent gains a +2 [ICON_Production].

Oblivion unique improvement. +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture, +1 [ICON_Production] Production. If next to a Encampent gains a +2 [ICON_Production] Production. If its built on a foreign continent gains +2 [ICON_Faith] Faith.

Oblivion unique improvement. +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold, +1 [ICON_Production] Production. If next to a Encampent gains a +2 [ICON_Production] Production. If its built on a foreign continent gains +2 [ICON_Faith] Faith.

Ayleid unique improvement. +1 [ICON_Science] Science, +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith. Cannot be built on hills. If next to a Campus gains a +1 [ICON_Science]. If next to a Holy Site gains a +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith.

Dwemer unique improvement. Occupying unit receives +4 [ICON_Strength] Defense Strength, and automatically gains 2 turns of fortification. +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold, +1 [ICON_Production] Production. If next to a Industrial Zone gains a +2 [ICON_Production].
